SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData

SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE > Class Template Reference

Class NodeData<TYPE> provides an implementation for data defined at nodes on AMR patches. It is derived from the hier::PatchData interface common to all SAMRAI patch data types. Given a CELL-centered AMR index space box, a node data object represents data of some template TYPE and depth at the nodes of the cells in the box. Here, depth indicates the number of data values at each node index location. The NodeGeometry class provides the translation between the standard SAMRAI cell-centered AMR index space and node-centered data. More...

#include <source/SAMRAI/pdat/NodeData.h>

Detailed Description

template<class TYPE>
class SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >

Class NodeData<TYPE> provides an implementation for data defined at nodes on AMR patches. It is derived from the hier::PatchData interface common to all SAMRAI patch data types. Given a CELL-centered AMR index space box, a node data object represents data of some template TYPE and depth at the nodes of the cells in the box. Here, depth indicates the number of data values at each node index location. The NodeGeometry class provides the translation between the standard SAMRAI cell-centered AMR index space and node-centered data.

A node data array is stored in (i,...,k,d) order, where i,...,k indicates spatial indices and the d indicates the component depth at that locaion. Memory allocation is in column-major ordering (e.g., Fortran style) so that the leftmost index runs fastest in memory. For example, a three-dimensional node data object created over a CELL-centered AMR index space box [l0:u0,l1:u1,l2:u2] allocates a data array sized as 

 *
 *   [ l0 : u0+1 ,
 *     l1 : u1+1,
 *     l2 : u2+1 , d ]
 *
 *

Other spatial dimensions are represented similarly.

The data type TYPE must define a default constructor (that takes no arguments) and also the assignment operator.

See also:
ArrayData
hier::PatchData
NodeDataFactory
NodeIndex
NodeIterator
NodeGeometry

Member Typedef Documentation

template<class TYPE>
typedef NodeIterator SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::iterator

The node iterator iterates over the elements of a node centered box geometry. This typedef is a convenience for using the NodeIterator class.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<class TYPE >
SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::NodeData ( const hier::Box &  box,
int  depth,
const hier::IntVector &  ghosts 
) [inline]

The constructor for a node data object.

Parameters:
box const Box reference describing the interior of the standard CELL-centered index box over which the node data object will be created.
depth gives the number of components for each spatial location in the array.
ghosts const IntVector reference indicating the width of the ghost cell region around the box over which the node data will be allocated.
Precondition:
box.getDim() == ghosts.getDim()
depth > 0
ghosts.min() >= 0

References SAMRAI::hier::PatchData::getGhostBox(), SAMRAI::hier::IntVector::min(), TBOX_ASSERT, TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2, and SAMRAI::pdat::NodeGeometry::toNodeBox().

template<class TYPE >
size_t SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::getSizeOfData ( const hier::Box &  box,
int  depth,
const hier::IntVector &  ghosts 
) [inline, static]

Calculate the amount of memory needed to represent node- centered data over a CELL-centered AMR index space box.

This function assumes that the amount of memory needed for TYPE is sizeof(TYPE). If this is not the case, then a specialized function must be defined.

Parameters:
box const Box reference describing the interior of the standard CELL-centered index box over which the node data object will be created.
depth gives the number of components for each spatial location in the array.
ghosts const IntVector reference indicating the width of the ghost cell region around the box over which the node data will be allocated.
Precondition:
box.getDim() == ghosts.getDim()
depth > 0

References SAMRAI::hier::Box::grow(), TBOX_ASSERT, TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2, and SAMRAI::pdat::NodeGeometry::toNodeBox().

template<class TYPE >
void SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::copy ( const hier::PatchData &  src  )  [inline, virtual]

A fast copy from source to destination (i.e., this) patch data object.

Data is copied where there is overlap in the underlying index space. The copy is performed on the interior plus the ghost cell width (for both the source and destination). Currently, source data must be a NodeData of the same DIM and TYPE. If not, then an unrecoverable error results.

Precondition:
getDim() == src.getDim()

References SAMRAI::hier::PatchData::copy2(), SAMRAI::hier::Box::empty(), and TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2.

template<class TYPE >
void SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::copy2 ( hier::PatchData &  dst  )  const [inline, virtual]

A fast copy from source (i.e., this) to destination patch data object.

Data is copied where there is overlap in the underlying index space. The copy is performed on the interior plus the ghost cell width (for both the source and destination). Currently, destination data must be a NodeData of the same DIM and TYPE. If not, then an unrecoverable error results.

Precondition:
getDim() == dst.getDim()
dynamic_cast<NodeData<TYPE> *>(&dst) != 0

References SAMRAI::hier::Box::empty(), TBOX_ASSERT, and TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2.

const hier::BoxOverlap &  overlap 
) [inline, virtual]

Copy data from source to destination (i.e., this) patch data object on the given overlap.

Currently, source data must be NodeData of the same DIM and TYPE and the overlap must be a NodeOverlap of the same DIM. If not, then an unrecoverable error results.

Precondition:
getDim() == src.getDim()

References SAMRAI::hier::PatchData::copy2(), SAMRAI::hier::Transformation::NO_ROTATE, and TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2.

Return true if the patch data object can estimate the stream size required to fit its data using only index space information (i.e., a box).

This routine is defined for the standard types (bool, char, double, float, int, and dcomplex).

template<class TYPE >
void SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::print ( const hier::Box &  box,
std::ostream &  os = tbox::plog,
int  prec = 12 
) const [inline]

Print all node data values residing in the specified box. If the depth of the array is greater than one, all depths are printed.

Parameters:
box const reference to box over whioch to print data. Note box is assumed to reside in standard cell-centered index space and will be converted to node index space.
os reference to output stream.
prec integer precision for printing floating point numbers (i.e., TYPE = float, double, or dcomplex). The default is 12 decimal places for double and complex floating point numbers, and the default is 6 decimal places floats. For other types, this value is ignored.
Precondition:
getDim() == box.getDim()

References TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2.

template<class TYPE >
void SAMRAI::pdat::NodeData< TYPE >::print ( const hier::Box &  box,
int  depth,
std::ostream &  os = tbox::plog,
int  prec = 12 
) const [inline]

Print all node data values at the given array depth in the specified box.

Parameters:
box const reference to box over whioch to print data. Note box is assumed to reside in standard cell-centered index space and will be converted to node index space.
depth integer depth component, must satisfy 0 <= depth < actual depth of data array
os reference to output stream.
prec integer precision for printing floating point numbers (i.e., TYPE = float, double, or dcomplex). The default is 12 decimal places for double and complex floating point numbers, and the default is 6 decimal places floats. For other types, this value is ignored.
Precondition:
getDim() == box.getDim()
(depth >= 0) && (depth < getDepth())

References SAMRAI::pdat::NodeGeometry::begin(), SAMRAI::pdat::NodeGeometry::end(), TBOX_ASSERT, and TBOX_ASSERT_OBJDIM_EQUALITY2.
